question: Who has the right to run as a candidate in federal elections?
possible_answers: A. Any person who is at least 18 years or older
B. Any Canadian citizen who is at least 18 years old
C. Canadian citizens and landed immigrants
D. A Canadian citizen who is 16 years or older
main_question: Who has the right to run as a candidate in federal elections?
answer: B. Any Canadian citizen who is at least 18 years old
explanatory_sentence: Canadian citizens who are 18 years old or older may run in a federal election. The people who run for office are called candidates.
